Package org.klotski.coding

Class UsernameCollector

java.lang.Object
org.klotski.coding.UsernameCollector
public class UsernameCollector extends Object
UsernameCollector reads a list of users in users.txt file, placed in resources/users_record.
It stores every user and can select one of them.
It is also possible to add a new user and write it in the txt file,
he stores it in a Vector.
It also gives the list of users, writing before the last used user.
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Andrea Mutti, Alessandro Girlanda, Alba Casanica, Matteo Meneghin
See Also:
  • Vector

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    UsernameCollector()
    Constructor that tries to read users.txt with readUsers().
    If there is no "users.txt" file, it tries to create one.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addUser(String user)
    Adds one user into the vector and writes it into users.txt.
    It writes the names uppercase and checks if the file is correct
    String
    getSelectedUser()
    Get the selected user
    Vector<String>
    getUsers()
    Get the vector of users
    boolean
    hasUsers()
    Boolean function to see if the vector is void
    void
    setSelectedUser(String selectedUser)
    Selects the given user as The selected one.
    If that user is not written in the file it writes it and adds it in the vector, in the first position.
    It also changes the position of a user in the Vector and places it in the first position.

    • UsernameCollector

      public UsernameCollector()
      Constructor that tries to read users.txt with readUsers().
      If there is no "users.txt" file, it tries to create one.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an unpredictable error occurred

  • Method Details

    • addUser

      public void addUser(String user)
      Adds one user into the vector and writes it into users.txt.
      It writes the names uppercase and checks if the file is correct
      Parameters:
      user - The username to add
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the file is in a non-correct written method

    • setSelectedUser

      public void setSelectedUser(String selectedUser)
      Selects the given user as The selected one.
      If that user is not written in the file it writes it and adds it in the vector, in the first position.
      It also changes the position of a user in the Vector and places it in the first position.
      Parameters:
      selectedUser - The username to select
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the file is in a non-correct written method, or the user is not in the vector

    • getUsers

      public Vector<String> getUsers()
      Get the vector of users
      Returns:
      A String-Vector contains all the users

    • getSelectedUser

      public String getSelectedUser()
      Get the selected user
      Returns:
      The selected user

    • hasUsers

      public boolean hasUsers()
      Boolean function to see if the vector is void
      Returns:
      If the user size is major than 0
